trans-unit.source: When you create a new virtual machine (VM) in a Resource Group by deploying an image from [Azure Marketplace](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/), the default OS drive is 127 GB.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new virtual machine (VM) in a Resource Group by deploying an image from [Azure Marketplace](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/), the default OS drive is 127 GB.

trans-unit.source: Even though it’s possible to add data disks to the VM (how many depending upon the SKU you’ve chosen) and moreover it’s recommended to install applications and CPU intensive workloads on these addendum disks, oftentimes customers need to expand the OS drive to support certain scenarios such as following:

trans-unit.source: Support legacy applications that install components on OS drive.

trans-unit.source: Migrate a physical PC or virtual machine from on-premises with a larger OS drive.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT]Azure has two different deployment models for creating and working with resources: Resource Manager and Classic.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT]Azure has two different deployment models for creating and working with resources: Resource Manager and Classic.

trans-unit.source: This article covers using the Resource Manager model.
trans-unit.target: This article covers using the Resource Manager model.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft recommends that most new deployments use the Resource Manager model.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft recommends that most new deployments use the Resource Manager model.
